string.text: Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villager</color> Food gathering from <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Huntable</color> animals.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+10% Gathering Rate</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Huntables</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villager</color> efficiency.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Carry Capacity</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+5% Movement Speed</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villager</color> Food gathering from <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Berry Bushes</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Gathering Rate</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villager</color> Wood gathering from <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Trees</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+15% Gathering Rate</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villager</color> Food gathering from <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Farms</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+10% Gathering Rate</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villager</color> Gold gathering from <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Gold Deposits</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+12% Gathering Rate</color>

Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villager</color> Stone gathering from <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Stone Mines</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+12% Gathering Rate</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Conservation</color>
Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Ships</color>. Provides a resource drop site.
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Fishing Boat</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Gathering Rate</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Carry Capacity</color>
A combat-class vessel, the Trireme brings its full weight to bear when engaging enemies.
Combining both siege and naval capabilities, the Ballista Trireme rains terror on enemy fortifications from offshore.
A devastating addition to any armada, the Fire Ship fights other Ships with fire during combat.
Able to transport land units across water, the Merchant Transport also trades between Docks for Gold.
A basic defensive building. Provides garrison for <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color>.
Heavily armored, the Hoplite resists damage from Ranged units while effectively battling Cavalry and Siege units.
Wielding dual swords, the Hypaspist cuts through other Infantry units with ease.
Armed against piercing attacks, the javelin-wielding Peltast excels at taking out other Ranged units.
Armed with an ancient early crossbow, the Gastraphetes' long range and high damage allows it to wipe out Infantry from afar.
Possessing great strength and resilience, the Hippikon makes the perfect all-around Cavalry unit.
Able to strike with incredible speed and precision, the Prodromos wages war effectively against Cavalry but falls hard to Spearmen.
An ancient Greek siege engine, the Ballista lays waste to both Ranged units and Buildings.
Crucial when supporting a long-lasting economy, the Caravan trades between Markets and Town Centers for Gold.
A strong defensive building. Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Palintonons</color> and Advisor units. Provides garrison for <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color>.
A superior long-range Siege unit, the Palintonon reduces heavy defenses to rubble in a matter of seconds.
The most basic military unit, the Spearman excels at overcoming Cavalry.
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Hoplite</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Cavalry</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Pierce Armor</color>
The basic archer, the Toxotes deals massive amounts of damage from afar, especially when in large numbers.
Mounted on horseback and armed with javelins, the Sarissophoroi easily defeats archers but are vulnerable to attack from Spearmen and other Cavalry.

Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Prodromos</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Siege</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Buildings</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Snare</color>
A slow but sturdy war machine, the Battering Ram smashes into Walls and Buildings with incredible force.
An elementary Ship unit, the Fishing Boat gathers food from Fish and repairs other damaged Ships and Buildings.
Increases melee damage for all <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Military</color> units.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Melee-Infantry Damage</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Melee-Cavalry Damage</color>
Increases pierce damage for all <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Military</color> units.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Pierce Damage</color>
Providing support in and out of combat, the Priest converts enemy units and heals friendly units out of combat.
Provides unlimited source of Food that <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color> can gather from.
A resource drop site, used to shorten gathering distances.
Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color>. Provides a resource drop site. Increases population limit by 20. Provides garrison for <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color>.
A basic worker unit, the Villager gathers resources, builds Buildings, and repairs damaged Buildings and Siege units.
Able to inflict great damage from a distance, the Chariot Archer controls the battlefield with its range and mobility.
Striking fear in the hearts of its enemies, the mighty War Elephant deals massive area damage to all who oppose it.
A powerful mounted unit, the Elephant Archer rains deadly arrows on its enemies.
Hurling boulders across the battlefield, the Catapult lays waste to both Ranged units and Buildings.

A strong defensive building. Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>War Elephants</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Elephant Archers</color>, and Advisor units. Provides garrison for <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color> and <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Priestesses of Ra</color>.
Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Priest of Set</color>. Advances civilization to the <color=0.58 0.74 0.81>Silver Age</color>.
Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Priest of Ptah</color>. Advances civilization to the <color=0.92 0.64 0.19>Golden Age</color>.
Able to heal friendly units, the Priestess of Ra also empowers buildings to give economic and training speed boosts.
Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Priestesses of Ra</color>. Advances civilization to the <color=0.94 0.51 0.23>Bronze Age</color>.
A harbinger of chaos, the Priest of Set inflicts chaos on enemy units, causing them to be hostile toward all other units.
A powerful support unit, the Priest of Ptah converts multiple enemy units and Buildings in a small area.

Improves Egyptian <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Priest</color> units.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Healing Range</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Chaos Range</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Conversion Range</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Line-of-Sight</color>
Reduces cost of Egyptian <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Priest</color> units.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-30% Cost</color>
Reduces training time of Egyptian <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Priest</color> units.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-40% Training Time</color>
Technologies unlocked in this row are immediately available during quests.
Reaching the <color=0.94 0.51 0.23>Bronze Age</color> unlocks the technologies in this row.
Reaching the <color=0.58 0.74 0.81>Silver Age</color> unlocks the technologies in this row.
Reaching the <color=0.92 0.64 0.19>Golden Age</color> unlocks the technologies in this row.
Possessing one for a period of time leads to victory in player vs. player combat.
A fast-moving unit with exceptional sight, the Scout specializes in exploring the map and scouting enemy territory. Builds <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Watch Posts</color>.
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Spearman</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Health</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-100% Gold Cost</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-50% Training Time</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Battering Ram</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Damage</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+15% Movement Speed</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>Grants Snare Immunity</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Spearman</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Cavalry</color></color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+15% Movement Speed</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Slinger</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Pierce Armor</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-20% Training Time</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Line-of-Sight</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Chariot Archer</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Health</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Infantry</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Camel Rider</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+100% Bonus Damage vs.</color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Ranged</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Pierce Armor</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>War Elephant</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Pierce Armor</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Conversion Resistance</color>
Increases capacity of <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Merchant Transport</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+8 Transport Capacity</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Long Swordsman</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Melee-Infantry Armor</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Pierce Armor</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Woad Raider</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>Grants Area Damage To Charge Attack</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>Grants Snare Immunity</color>

Grants <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Augur</color> the ability to sacrifice animals for a <color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-30% Training Time</color> boost. Affects all <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Buildings</color> for a short period of time. \n● Duration: 45s\n● Cooldown: 1m30s

Grants <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Augur</color> the ability to sacrifice animals for a <color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+15% Damage</color> boost. Affects all <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Military</color> units for a short period of time. \n● Duration: 45s\n● Cooldown: 1m30s

Grants <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Augur</color> the ability to sacrifice animals for a <color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+15% Movement Speed</color> boost. Affects all <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Military</color> units for a short period of time. \n● Duration: 45s\n● Cooldown: 1m30s

Grants <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Augur</color> the ability to sacrifice animals for a <color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Damage vs. Buildings</color> boost. Affects all <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Military</color> units for a short period of time. \n● Duration: 45s\n● Cooldown: 1m30s
Reduces research time of all upgrades.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-40% Research Time</color>
Reduces training time of <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Infantry</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Ranged</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Cavalry</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-25% Training Time</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Guard Tower</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Damage</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>Removes Minimum Attack Range</color>

Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Toxotes</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Gastraphetes</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Buildings</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Buildings</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Siege</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Ships</color>
Heavily armored, the Champion shrugs off most attacks while cleaving its foes, dealing area damage to other enemies nearby.
A durable chariot, the Carpentom excels at defeating other large Ranged units.
Feared for its mobility and power, the Woad Raider charges into battle with a devastating attack.
A strong defensive building. Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Rams</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Stone Throwers</color>, and Advisor units. Provides garrison for <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color>.
Garrisons and protects <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color> for more efficient gathering of Gold.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Gold Conservation</color>
Adept in both combat and healing, the Druid also boosts the damage of friendly injured units. \n\n(Boosts the damage of nearby friendly units by 20% while healing them.)
Able to learn rites to sacrifice animals, the Augur also converts enemy units and heals friendly units out of combat.
Lightly armored and quick on its feet, the Slinger excels at taking out other Ranged units.
Lightly armored, the Slinger excels at taking out other Ranged units, but cannot withstand high amounts of damage.
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villager</color> efficiency.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Carry Capacity</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+10% Movement Speed</color>
Able to absorb large amounts of pierce damage, the Sparabara provides a near impenetrable line of defense.
Posessing both melee and ranged weaponry, the Immortal stands as the elite of the Persian army.
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Mounted Archer</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-50% Gold Cost</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Cavalry</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>War Wagon</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Health</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>Grants Larger Area Damage</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Ram Ship</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Buildings</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Movement Speed</color>
Grants <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Storehouses</color> the ability to heal nearby friendly units.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+10 Health Per Second</color>

Reduces training time of <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villager</color>, but changes their cost to Gold.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-45% Training Time</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-40 Food Cost</color>*<color=1.0 0.0 0.0>+40 Gold Cost</color>*<color=1.0 1.0 0.0>Can Be Toggled On/Off</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Ram</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Health</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-40% Training Time</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>Grants Snare Immunity</color>

Reduces training time of <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Barracks</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Archery Range</color>, and <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Stable units</color>, but increases their cost.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-30% Training Time</color>*<color=1.0 0.0 0.0>+15% Cost</color>*<color=1.0 1.0 0.0>Can Be Toggled On/Off</color>

Increases <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Sparabara</color> health and crush armor, but decreases their speed.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Health</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+180% Crush Armor</color>*<color=1.0 0.0 0.0>-10% Movement Speed</color>

Increases attack range of <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Bowman</color> and <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Takabara</color>, but decreases their health.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+30% Maximum Range</color>*<color=1.0 0.0 0.0>-15% Health</color>

Reduces training time of <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Immortal Camp</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Siege Workshop</color>, and <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Fortress units</color>, but increases their cost.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-60% Training Time</color>*<color=1.0 0.0 0.0>+30% Cost</color>*<color=1.0 1.0 0.0>Can Be Toggled On/Off</color>
A relatively fast and disposable Siege unit, the Ram shakes the foundation of any sturdy structure.
An all-around, versatile Cavalry unit, the Asabara excels at raiding and focused attacks.
A bowman mounted on horseback, the Mounted Archer easily counters other mounted Cavalry units.
Clad in heavy armor from head to toe, the Cataphract decimates any Infantry unit in its wake.
A mobile mini-fortress, the War Wagon showers its enemies with piercing arrows.
A sacred animal that can be used as a source of Food or can be sacrificed by the Augur.
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Stone Thrower</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Siege</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>-1 Population Count</color>
Increases melee armor for all <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Military</color> units.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Melee-Infantry Armor</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Melee-Cavalry Armor</color>
Increases pierce armor for all <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Military</color> units.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Pierce Armor</color>

Increases melee and pierce armor for all <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Military</color> units.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Melee-Infantry Armor</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Melee-Cavalry Armor</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+20% Pierce Armor</color>

Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Spearman</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+25% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Cavalry</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Buildings</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Slinger</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+50% Bonus Damage vs. </color><color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+15% Movement Speed</color>
Egypt's weapon specialist, the Axeman dispatches Infantry units with ease.
Adept in mobility, the Camel Rider easily defeats other Cavalry units but is vulnerable to attacks from Spearmen.
Combining both siege and naval capabilities, the Catapult Trireme rains terror on enemy fortifications from offshore.
A slow but sturdy war machine, the Siege Tower smashes into Walls and Buildings with incredible force.
A basic archer, the Bowman deals massive amounts of damage from afar, especially when in large numbers.
Armed against piercing attacks, the javelin-wielding Takabara excels at taking out other Ranged units.
An early warship before the invention of the Trireme, the Galley rocks the boat in any naval engagement.
Combining both siege and naval capabilities, the Mangonel Galley rains terror on enemy fortifications from offshore.
Built for head-on collisions, the Ram Ship smashes into enemy Ships and Buildings to deal massive structural damage.
Providing support in and out of combat, the Magus converts enemy units and heals friendly units out of combat.
Renowned for its bravery, the Long Swordsman hacks through Infantry with a feverous vigor.
A hearty mounted warrior, the Horseman excels at keeping other Cavalry units at bay.
Built from the strongest of oak, the Swanship sails the seas with exceptional power.
Harnessing incredible strength, the Stone Thrower hurls large stones at its victims.
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Camel Rider</color> and <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Chariot Archer</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+10% Movement Speed</color>
Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Camel Rider</color> and <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Chariot Archer</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+10% Movement Speed</color>

Greatly improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Wall</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+200% Health</color>*<color=1.0 0.0 0.0>Converts Cost to Stone</color>

Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Asabara</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Mounted Archer</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Cataphract</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+10% Health</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+10% Damage</color>*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+5% Movement Speed</color>

Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Lancer</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Mounted Archer</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Chariot Archer</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>War Chariot</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+10% Movement Speed</color>

Improves <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Lancer</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Mounted Archer</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Chariot Archer</color>, <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>War Chariot</color>.*<color=0.0 1.0 0.0>+10% Movement Speed</color>

Able to absorb large amounts of pierce damage, the Shield Bearer provides a near impenetrable line of defense.
A mobile Storehouse, used to shorten gathering distances.
Equipped with a variety of armaments, the Sapper specializes in undermining fortifications.
A protector of kings, the Royal Guard seldom meets its equal in hand-to-hand combat.
Boasting an exceptionally long spear, the Lancer slams into Infantry lines, dealing incredible damage.
A durable chariot, the War Chariot excels at defeating other large Ranged units.
Capable of garrisoning large armies, the Siege Tower often surprises its enemy while laying siege.

Empowers all <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Buildings</color> and provides a small trickle of Food. Predecessor to the Trireme, the Bireme effectively battles in the open sea.

Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Priests</color>. Researches advanced upgrades. Advances civilization to <color=0.94 0.51 0.23>Bronze</color> , <color=0.58 0.74 0.81>Silver</color>, and <color=0.92 0.64 0.19>Golden Age</color>.

Skilled in the art of axe throwing, the Throwing Axeman cuts down Infantry units before they even lift their weapon. Builds military and defensive <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Buildings</color>.
Hardened by war and cold winters, the Harjar makes it tough for any foe to break the front line. Builds military and defensive <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Buildings</color>.
Having an unquenchable thirst for battle, the Berserker cleaves its enemies in a maniacal fury. Builds military and defensive <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Buildings</color>.

Clad only in wolfskins, the Ulfheðinn wastes Ranged and Cavalry units with incredible speed and agility. Builds military and defensive <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Buildings</color>.

Cheap and expendable, the Raider is as dangerous on the battlefield as it is when raiding.

Graceful, light, and narrow, the Longship rivals some of the toughest ships on the sea, while also providing a sizeable transport.
Ready at a moment's notice, the War Dog keeps enemies from fleeing the battlefield.

Capable of converting enemy units, the Seer also summons Ravens to fly around and gather critical information.
A talented musician and poet, the Rhapsode serenades its enemies and brings comfort and healing to large groups of friendly units out of combat.
A fearsome war leader, the Chief boosts the health and courage of all nearby friendly units. \n\n(Boosts the health of nearby friendly units by 20% in a large area.)
Harnessing incredible strength, the Log Thrower hurls large wooden logs at its victims.
Increases population limit by 10. Provides garrison for <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color>.
A fast-moving unit with exceptional sight, the Scout specializes in exploring the map and scouting enemy territory. Builds <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Outposts</color>.
A fast-moving unit with exceptional sight, the Scout specializes in exploring the map and scouting enemy territory. Builds <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Barracks</color>.
Dragging a giant boulder by hand, the Farbjoðr makes quick work of any Building in its way.
A strong defensive building. Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Farbjoðr</color> and <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Log Throwers</color>. Provides garrison for <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color>.
The most basic military unit, the Spearman excels at overcoming Cavalry. Builds military and defensive <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Buildings</color>.
A strong defensive building. Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Palintonons</color>. Provides garrison for <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color>.

Increases population limit by 5. 

Required for advancing civilization to Bronze, Silver and Golden Age. 

Number of Houses required: 

- <color=0.94 0.51 0.23>Bronze Age</color>: 3 

- <color=0.58 0.74 0.81>Silver Age</color>: 8 

- <color=0.92 0.64 0.19>Golden Age</color>: 20
Summoned by the Seer, the Raven flies around and gathers critical information.\nIt can bypass land obstacles and can only be attacked by units with a ranged attack.

Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color> and  <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Ox Carts</color>. Provides a resource drop site. Increases population limit by 20. Provides garrison for <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color>.
Trains <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Infantry</color> and <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Eques</color> units. Can be upgraded to have a Ranged Attack and provide garrison for <color=0.32 0.65 1.0>Villagers</color>.

An officer carrying the Roman standard into battle, the Aquilifer boosts the damage and courage of his nearby friendly units. \n\n(Boosts the damage of nearby friendly units by 10% in a large area.)
